alert.note: Alert for Caddo; Canadian; Grady (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 03 at 9:23PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Grady, east central Caddo and southern Canadian Counties through 1015 PM CDT... At 922 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Cogar to 3 miles southwest of Minco to 5 miles west of Anadarko. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southwestern Oklahoma City, Chickasha, Blanchard, Anadarko, Mustang, Tuttle, Union City, Minco, Binger, Fort Cobb, Verden, Amber, Bridge Creek, Gracemont, Pocasset, Cogar, Middleberg, Tabler, Albert and Lake Chickasha. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 137 and 141. Interstate 44 between mile markers 79 and 101. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
